course_desc: Exploration of how anthropology studies indigenous groups throughout the world. metadata: Prerequisites: CHN 302 or CHN 303 or CHN 305 ; or consent.

Inclusion of students with disabilities in the general education environment is stressed. Significant instruction on writing individualized education programs.

course_desc: Advanced reading in traditional literature; discussion of cultural implications; advanced oral communication and composition. Meets three hours weekly.

course_desc: Life and thought of the two Humboldt brothers. Alexander (1769-1859) helped to lay the foundations of modern science, including geology, geography, botany, zoology, physiology and anthropology. Older, less well-known Wilhelm (1767—1835) was an influential statesman, classical scholar, man of letters, humanist, political philosopher, anthropologist and linguist, and founded the University of Berlin. Review of the two polymaths’ impact on modern science in the Americas, the Pacific and Asia.

course_desc: Law of private agreements. Explores the evolution and application of common law doctrines, and, where applicable, relevant provisions of the Uniform Commercial Code. Examines the bases of promissory liability, contract formation, mutual assent, defenses to enforcement, excuses, remedies and damages, and the rights and interests of third parties. Attention will be paid throughout the course to the role of contracts in a market society and the conflicting interests of certainty, freedom of contract and fairness.

course_desc: Employment law, statutory rights affecting the employment relation, and alternative contract provisions to secure the parties’ intentions. Focus on the practical application of labor and employment law. Materials relating to the unionized employment relationship. Emphasis on the labor arbitration process and possibly, to issues regarding internal union affairs.

Introduction to medical jurisprudence, medical malpractice, informed consent, health care decisions, medical ethics, the health care industry, managed care, financing health care, and the role of government in health care.

course_desc: Examines both practice aspects and theoretical underpinnings of equitable remedies. Frequently, compensatory damages cannot adequately protect clients or provide them with the relief they need. Topics include temporary restraining orders, preliminary and permanent injunctions, restitution and unjust enrichment, specific performance, and equitable defenses such as unclean hands, laches, and estoppel. Practice issues concerning appeal, jury trials, and the relationship of equity to law are also explored.

course_desc: An extended historical review of the foundations of Japanese law in society: Japan’s adoption and adaptation of Chinese legal doctrines, continental European legal structures and ideas, and American influences. course_desc: Introduction to the study of language and language-related issues, with a focus on Hawaiʻi and the Pacific; (B) unit mastery; (C) lecture discussion with focus on writing as a grading criterion.

metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; General Education Designation(s): DS

course_desc: History of the discipline, schools of linguistic thought, current issues, etc.

course_desc: An overview of language endangerment, especially in the Pacific and Asia, and a critical examination of the strategies that are being developed to combat it.

course_desc: The exploration of business, personal, and interpersonal issues associated with a family owned and managed company. Topics include: family psychology and organizational structure, life cycles in family business, strategic family and business planning, succession planning, family business conflict resolution, estate planning, the role of professional managers, and others. This is not a course about how to become an entrepreneur or how to start or manage a business. It is most appropriate for those students who are part of a family that owns and manages a business.

course_desc: (2 Lec, 1 1-hr Lab) Applications of calculus (limits, continuity, derivatives, exponential and logarithmic functions, partials, integrals) to problems in business management, social sciences, and life sciences. Applies symbolic techniques and quantitative methods in problem solving, utilizes concept of proof as a chain of inferences, and promotes development of reasoning skills and mathematical logic in bridging theory and practice.

course_desc: Analysis of problems of development and management of natural resources with emphasis on resources in agriculture and role in economic development.
metadata: Prerequisites: ECON 608 and ECON 629 .; Cross-Listed: ECON 637 and SUST 637

course_desc: Analysis of our environment with emphasis on understanding relationships and interactions of physical, biological, technological, and political components using scientific methods of inquiry. Food supply and safety, water quality, pollution control, biodiversity, environmental policy. Open to nonmajors.
metadata: Cross-Listed: PEPS 210 and SUST 210; General Education Designation(s): DB

course_desc: Exploration of internship and career opportunities for NREM majors. Development of career-building skills, including resume, interview, and professional networking.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Major Restrictions: NREM majors only.

course_desc: Fundamentals of benefit-cost analysis with extensions to environmental impacts and projects; case studies.
metadata: Prerequisites: NREM 220 / SUST 220 or ECON 130 or consent.; Cross-Listed: SUST 358; General Education Designation(s): DS

course_desc: Introduction to NREM student learning outcomes and scholarly breadth within the department, exposure to on-campus resources, networking with current and former NREM students and external stakeholders, career skills development.
course_title: Introduction to Natural Resources and Environmental Management
metadata: Repeatable: 1 time; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only

course_desc: Major concepts of physics taught by means of hands-on conceptual activities for elementary and secondary teachers. Restricted to in-service teachers, or consent.
metadata: Repeatable: 1 time; Cross-Listed: PHYS 505

course_desc: Designed for students to identify essential nutrients required by plants; diagnose nutrient disorders in plants; and propose environmentally sound solutions to correct disorders.
course_title: Plant Nutrient Diagnosis in the Tropics
metadata: Prerequisites: NREM 304 / TPSS 304 (or concurrent) and BIOL 172 .; Cross-Listed: TPSS 475

course_desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Principles of ecosystem ecology with emphasis on tropical forests, human impacts, and global environmental change. Factors controlling ecosystem structure, productivity, nutrient cycling, plant-soil-atmosphere interactions, and energy balance. Field and laboratory methods in ecosystem science.
metadata: Prerequisites: advanced undergraduate coursework in ecology and soil science; graduate standing; and consent.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Alt. years: spring

course_desc: Origin, development, properties, management of tropical soils; classification of Hawaiian soils.
metadata: Prerequisites: ( CHEM 161 and CHEM 161L ) with a minimum grade of C, or consent.; Corequisites: NREM 304L; Grade Option: A-F only. Minimum prerequisite grade of C or consent.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Cross-Listed: TPSS 304; General Education Designation(s): DP

course_desc: Introduction to basic economics concepts, including demand, supply, exchange, market price and market failure. Economic evaluation and policy for the uses of various natural resource endowments, especially in production agriculture, is included.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Cross-Listed: SUST 220; General Education Designation(s): DS

course_desc: Fundamentals, techniques, and applications of remote sensing for natural resource assessments and environmental monitoring. Lab consisting of field radiometric exercises, computer modeling of energy-matter interaction, processing, and analysis of remotely sensed imagery.
metadata: Prerequisites: one physics course (e.g. PHYS 151 ), one calculus course (e.g. NREM 203 ), and one statistics course (e.g. NREM 310 ), or consent. Recommended: either GEO 470 or ERTH 460 or one introductory remote sensing course.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Alt years

course_desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Hydrologic properties in soils and the processes involved in water infiltration drainage and solute transport. Emphasis on key parameters required for modeling. Recommended:
metadata: Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Cross-Listed: BE 664 and CEE 625

course_desc: Exploration of institutional and policy dimensions of natural resource development, management, allocation, markets and pricing, focusing on their environmental impacts. Emphasis on policy analysis using case studies and empirical findings. Original paper required.
metadata: Prerequisites: grade of C- or above in ECON 130 or NREM 220 / SUST 220 , or consent.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Cross-Listed: SUST 611

course_desc: Field and analytical methods for exploring the origin, development, properties, and management of soils, with an emphasis on tropical and Hawaiian soils.
metadata: Prerequisites: ( CHEM 161 and CHEM 161L ) with a minimum grade of C.; Corequisites: NREM 304; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Cross-Listed: TPSS 304L; General Education Designation(s): DY

course_desc: Combined lecture, laboratory and discussion on the use of computers as a teaching tool in the classroom. To be taught in a hands-on manner appropriate for the science teachers. Restricted to in-service teachers or consent.
metadata: Repeatable: one time.; Grade Option: A-F only.

course_desc: Individual reading and/or research.
metadata: Prerequisites: consent.; Repeatable: 3 times, up to 24 credits.; Class Standing Restrictions: Junior standing or higher.

course_desc: Basic soil-water-plant relationships, irrigation water requirements, irrigation efficiencies, different methods of irrigation, planning, design and management of an irrigation system, fertigation and impact of irrigation on soil and water quality.
metadata: Prerequisites: NREM 203 (or equivalent) and NREM 304 / TPSS 304 (or equivalent), or consent.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Alt years; Cross-Listed: TPSS 463

course_desc: Principles and methods of agricultural accounting. Preparing and interpreting financial statements. Sources and costs of credit, capital budgeting, tax management, estate planning.
metadata: Prerequisites: NREM 220 / SUST 220 or ECON 130 or consent.; Repeatable: 1 time; Grade Option: A-F only.; Cross-Listed: TPSS 341; General Education Designation(s): DS

course_desc: Advanced environmental benefit-cost analysis will require that proficiency be demonstrated on fundamentals and address topics related to sustainability, including income equality, non-market goods, risk, cost of public funds, and the social discount rate.
metadata: Cross-Listed: SUST 658

course_desc: Instruction on social determinants of health, issues of health equity, and how these issues can be addressed through research. Discussions and activities promote a greater understanding of health disparities research.
metadata: Prerequisites: consent.; Repeatable: Unlimited times

course_desc: Biochemical and chemical principles of occurrence, distribution, biotic and abiotic conversion, fate, and impact of synthetic and natural molecules in the environment. Important pollutants will be used as case studies to illustrate the principles.
metadata: Prerequisites: CHEM 162 or CHEM 171 , or consent.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Cross-Listed: MBBE 412; General Education Designation(s): DB

course_desc: (1 4-hr Lab) Laboratory and field methods covering biological and physical principles and concepts in natural resource management. Emphasis on basic field measurement techniques, computer skills commonly used in managing natural resources and writing scientific lab reports.
metadata: Prerequisites: NREM 192 with a minimum grade of C-.; Corequisites: NREM 301; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Spring only; General Education Designation(s): DY

course_desc: Preparation for NREM Master’s Plan B capstone experience.
metadata: Prerequisites: NREM 600 and NREM 601 (or concurrent) (with a minimum grade of B-), and one graduate methods course (or concurrent).; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NREM majors only.

course_desc: Instruction on social determinants of health, issues of health equity, and how these issues can be addressed through research. Discussions and activities promote a greater understanding of health disparities research.
metadata: Prerequisites: consent.; Repeatable: 2 times, or up to 27 credits.

course_desc: Overview of the history of land, resources and power in Hawaiʻi; players and processes influencing land and natural resources policies today explored from Native Hawaiian and other viewpoints. Extensive use of case studies.
metadata: Prerequisites: HWST 207 / SUST 217 or HWST 307 / SUST 317 or HWST 356 / SUST 356; Cross-Listed: HWST 458 and SUST 456

course_desc: Introduction to Native Hawaiian health issues and traditional healing practices.
course_title: Native Hawaiian Health and Traditional Healing
metadata: Prerequisites: MDED 551 or consent.; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: MD majors only.

course_desc: Analysis of trends and strategies in international agricultural research and development. International agricultural research centers (IARC), Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), university networks and consortia, and private voluntary organizations (PVOs).
metadata: Class Standing Restrictions: graduate standing or advanced undergraduate standing, and consent.

course_desc: Experiential service learning course for students participating in the Hawaiʻi Youth Conservation Corps summer program as Hana Hou members. Hawaiʻi Youth Conservation Corps summer program students only.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Summer only

course_desc: Interdisciplinary methodologies for conducting research and impact analyses on agrarian systems, sustainable development, and resource management.
metadata: Prerequisites: consent.; Repeatable: 1 time; Frequency of Course (when offered): Alt. years: fall

course_desc: Provides a focused experience in clinical medicine with opportunities to practice the history and physical examination in Lau Ola, the clinical setting of the Department of Native Hawaiian Health.
course_title: Clinical Skills Preceptorship in the Lau Ola Clinic of the Department of Native Hawaiian Health
metadata: Prerequisites: MDED 574 or consent.; Repeatable: 1 time; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Major Restrictions: MD majors only.

course_desc: An in-depth study of topics from intermediate and high school mathematics. Restricted to in-service teachers or consent.
metadata: Repeatable: one time.; Grade Option: A-F only.

course_desc: Introduction to quantitative decision-making methods for effective agribusiness management in resource allocation, scheduling, logistics, risk analysis, inventory, and forecasting. Emphasis on problem identification, model formulation and solution, and interpretation and presentation of results.
course_title: Spreadsheet Modeling for Business and Economic Analysis
metadata: Prerequisites: NREM 220 / SUST 220 or ECON 130 , and SUST 310 or ECON 321 ; or consent.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Cross-Listed: ECON 429; General Education Designation(s): DS

course_desc: Journey through the Natural Sciences finding fun, excitement, and success in science, mathematics, engineering, medicine, and all that is the natural sciences. Focus upon challenging worldviews of belief, invention, impact, and ethics.
course_title: Natural Sciences and Life-Pulling the Puzzles Apart
metadata: Grade Option: CR/NC only.

course_desc: Provides an introduction to the HSNC Competencies and spiraling of concepts and is based on the assumption of student responsibility for learning. Emphasis on writing instruction, and research evidence to support nursing care.
course_title: Introduction to Evidence Based Practice and Health Promotion
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Nursing theory course designed to enhance proficiency in complex clinical judgments, interprofessional team collaboration, and leadership. Focus is on knowledge and skills needed for nursing practice, including case management and quality management.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 364 (or concurrent).; Corequisites: NURS 470L; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Focus on pathophysiological concepts that are basic to understanding illness and injury and the corresponding spectrum of human responses, which serve as a foundation for the formulation of clinical decisions and care planning.
metadata: Prerequisites: admission to the School of Nursing and Dental Hygiene, or consent.; Corequisites: NURS 210 , NURS 210L , and NURS 211 .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Field work focuses on community health nursing with an emphasis for the Executive RN on strategies applied to improve health and decrease health inequities at the local as well as national and international levels.
course_title: Community Health Nursing for Executive RN Field Work
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 301 and NURS 306 .; Corequisites: NURS 363 and NURS 462 .; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Explore contemporary ethical issues and their legal implications in health care. Focus on decision-making in professional practice and social policy formation.
course_title: Contemporary Ethical Issues in Health Care
metadata: Major Restrictions: open to non-nursing majors with consent.

course_desc: This second level course builds on the knowledge and skills gained in the first level and focuses on professional responsibilities in nursing practice and education.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 200; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Spring only; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Fundamentals of genetics and genomics, including principles of inheritance in humans, cellular function, mutations, epigenetics, and implications for health and disease. Includes overview of topics involving genetics/genomics in clinical settings and health care delivery.
course_title: Introduction to Genetics and Genomics in Nursing Practice
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 212 , NURS 220 , NURS 220L , and NURS 363 .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: A two-semester course with seminar in professional role development in addition to paid work experience in nursing at a local agency. Upper division
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 360 , NURS 360L , and faculty approval.; Repeatable: 1 time; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Exploration of major issues and roles in advanced practice psychiatric-mental health nursing.
metadata: Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Augment APRN students’ understanding, evaluation, treatment plan development, and competence to care for patients with mental health and psychiatric disorders treatment plans across the lifespan in the primary care settings.
metadata: Prerequisites: consent.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Clinical laboratory that focuses on clinical skills and procedures performed by advanced practice nurses (nurse practitioners and/or clinical nurse specialists). Topics will vary by section and semester.
course_title: Clinical Skills and Procedures for Advanced Practice Nursing
metadata: Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS and NURD majors only.

course_desc: Focus on well-child care and nursing care of children with acute and chronic conditions. Pediatric concepts include family-centered, developmentally appropriate, and atraumatic care. Critical thinking, clinical judgment, and EBP are applied.
course_title: Nursing Care of Children and Families Clinical/Lab
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 509; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Prepares APNs to evaluate, monitor, and prescribe pharmaceuticals to treat acute and chronic illness across lifespan. Emphasis on drug indications, mechanisms of action, clinical efficacy, adverse effects, interactions, monitoring, education, and cost effectiveness. Enrollment as a classified student in a SONDH graduate degree program.
course_title: Pharmacology for Nurses in Advanced Practice
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 613 (or concurrent) or consent.; Repeatable: Unlimited times; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Will learn ship design and control, hydrodynamic forces, stability, electrical theory, and damage control coupled with design of steam, gas turbine and nuclear propulsion. Case studies merging both ethical and technical challenges.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only

course_desc: Selected emerging diseases are examined within historical context, known science (past and present) and societal factors that influence prevention, detection, treatment and containment strategies. Considerations for advanced public health nursing practice are identified and examined.
course_title: Emerging Diseases & Implications for Advanced Nursing Practice
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Spring only; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Focuses on complex situations requiring strong recognition skills, and rapid decision making. The evidence base supporting assessment and nursing intervention is explored.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 321 , NURS 321L , NURS 322 , and NURS 322L , or departmental approval.; Corequisites: NURS 360L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Web-enhanced on pathophysiologic concepts as a basis of illness and injury and the corresponding spectrum of human response, which serves as a foundation for the formulation of clinical decisions and care planning.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Review of contemporary national health policies, issues and concerns; and international comparison of health policy evolution; includes didactic and 45 hours of fieldwork experience learning.

Nursing care and health promotion for women, newborn, and families in acute and community settings. Utilization of family theories and assessment tools when providing culturally sensitive, family-centered care. Emphasis on teaching writing for the profession.
course_title: Women, Newborn, and Family Health Lab
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 220 and NURS 220L and NURS 213 .; Corequisites: NURS 321; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.; Class Standing Restrictions: Sophomore standing or higher.

course_desc: Overview of the NCLEX-RN licensure examination and regular, systematic practice in taking multiple choice examinations.
metadata: Major Restrictions: open to non-nursing majors with consent.

course_desc: Clinical course focuses on a health promotion model of care, assessment, and communication skills. Introduces nurse’s roles, code of ethics, and evidence-based practice.
course_title: Health Promotion Across the Lifespan Lab
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 210 , NURS 211 , and NURS 212 .; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Explores attitudes toward the aged, biological and psychological aspects, ethnicity, sexuality, nutritional problems, community resources, other related topics.
metadata: Major Restrictions: open to non-nursing majors with consent.

course_desc: Introduction to the use of information systems in healthcare. Selected information systems and data sets are explored with application of results to various patient populations and clinical practice settings.
course_title: Introduction to Information Technology in Healthcare

course_desc: Theory on population and global health nursing with emphasis on analysis of strategies to address concepts of health disparities, inequity, social justice issues, and ethics which impact health outcomes of populations.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 364 (or concurrent); Corequisites: NURS 451L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: Nursing majors only.; Class Standing Restrictions: Senior standing or higher.

course_desc: (2 Sem, 8-hr Lab) Opportunity to develop specialized clinical competence in assessment of children as a basis for the development of clinical specialization. Development of the individual’s potential toward health maintenance functioning.
metadata: Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Focuses on a health promotion model of care, assessment, and communication skills. It introduces the nurse’s roles, code of ethics, and evidence-based practice.
metadata: Prerequisites: admission to the School of Nursing and Dental Hygiene, or consent.; Corequisites: NURS 210L , NURS 211 , and NURS 212 .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Involves directed, mentored research study for Nursing Honors students with their honors advisor. The course grade depends on meeting objectives negotiated each course semester.
metadata: Prerequisites: acceptance into the Honors Program.; Repeatable: 3 times.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Biopsychosocial theories of human behavior related to function, alteration, and/or disruption of mental processes; reviews current knowledge related to nursing care, psychiatric treatment/psychosocial rehabilitation of identified mentally ill adults/children and their families.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 507L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Examines the legal, ethical and therapeutic role of the psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioner (PMHNP) in prescribing psychotropic medications for diverse groups of individuals across the lifespan. Diverse biopsychosocial perspectives will be considered.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Investigation of epidemiologic and biostatistical methods for advance practice nurses within healthcare settings and complementary roles of epi/biostatistics in shaping advance nurse practice. Application of epi/biostatistical approaches to the design and analysis of DNP projects.
course_title: Applied Biostatistics and Epidemiology for Nurses in Advance Practice
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or permission.

course_desc: Survey of complementary and alternative therapies used for health promotion of individuals and groups.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only. Open to non-nursing majors with consent.

course_desc: Focuses on professional leadership development, mentorship, and professional skills for nurses. Students learn to be representatives between the Department of Nursing and alumni, prospective students, and the general public.
metadata: Prerequisites: one semester as a Nursing Student Ambassador.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Provides an overview of the concepts and application of health education and health promotion theories and principles as applies to individuals, groups, and the larger public.
metadata: Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Major Restrictions: open to non-nursing majors with consent.; Cross-Listed: DH 361

course_desc: Deliver comprehensive nursing care to clients with complex needs in community and/or acute care settings. Leadership, management, and quality improvement competencies are stressed.
course_title: Clinical Immersion to Nursing Practice Lab
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 517; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission to GEPN only.

course_desc: Provides students with an understanding of different roles of the advanced professional nurse; an ability to proactively manage the environment of their specialty practice; includes 45 hours of field work experience.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.

course_desc: Examination of continuity of care for clients with complex needs. Emphasis on application of leadership, management, and quality improvement in the clinical setting.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 517L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission to GEPN only.

course_desc: Nursing care and health promotion lab for children and families. Application of concepts related to the delivery of family-centered holistic, culturally sensitive, therapeutic nursing care to children and families in acute care and community settings.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 213 and NURS 220 and NURS 220L .; Corequisites: NURS 322; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.; Class Standing Restrictions: Sophomore standing or higher.

course_desc: Focuses on enhancing students’ writing abilities through an in-depth examination of the historical foundations of contemporary warfighting theories, encompassing philosophies, domains, tactics, and technology.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only

course_desc: The first of two courses that focuses on the delivery of advanced practice nursing in the assessment, diagnosis, and management of common acute and chronic adult health problems in the acute care setting.
course_title: Human Responses to Acute and Chronic Illness-A
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 612 , NURS 612L , and NURS 613 ; no waiver.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Provides an understanding of normal physiological mechanisms and pathological processes to serve as a foundation for clinical assessment, decision making, and clinical management across the lifespan.
metadata: Major Restrictions: Enrollment as a classified student in a graduate program in SONDH. NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Seminar on theory/research in advanced psychiatric-mental health nursing of adolescents and families representing diverse populations. Emphasis on developmental and nursing theories, evidence-based practice, therapeutic modalities and disease management of psychiatric illness.
course_title: Adolescent and Family Psychiatric- Mental Health Care
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 611 (or concurrent) or consent.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year

course_desc: This first level course focuses on nursing practice and education. Professional responsibilities in the practice of nursing are emphasized.
metadata: Prerequisites: admittance into HS-DEN program.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Diagnosis and management of health and illness with emphasis on clients with common acute/episodic conditions seen in context of family and community. Advanced practice nurse-client relationship, practice roles, and culturally relevant care are included.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 613 and NURS 629 .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Application of the nursing process and scientific based nursing interventions to meet basic human needs using basic psycho-motor skills to support assessment, intervention, and evaluation activities.
course_title: Foundations of Nursing Science and Practice Lab
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 505; Grade Option: CR/ NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Outlines the theory and employment of naval warship weapons systems. Supplemented with review/ analysis of case studies involving the moral and ethical responsibilities of leaders in the employment of weapons.
metadata: Prerequisites: NAVL 301; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Spring only

course_desc: Application of the bio/psycho/social human health response to a wide range of conditions. Application of health promotion, risk reduction and disease detection and nursing care treatments in the acute care setting.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 513; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Clinical course focuses on community, public, and global health nursing emphasizing application of strategies to improve health and decrease health inequities at the local, national, and international levels. Emphasis on oral and writing instruction.
course_title: Community, Public, and Global Health Nursing Lab
metadata: Prerequisites: 360, 360L, and 363.; Corequisites: 450, 465, and 465L.; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Identification and synthesis of pertinent biopsychosocial and cultural data to complete advanced psychiatric-mental health assessments and diagnoses.
metadata: Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Embark in a writing and oral-focused exploration of the USMC as the premiere Maneuver Warfighting Organization. Delve into theoretical concepts and historical examples, examining foundational principles through written analysis and oral discussion.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only

course_desc: Application of assessment skills in dry lab and clinical settings, with attention to principles of communication, interviewing and physical examination skills.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 501 , NURS 502 , NURS 503 , NURS 504 , NURS 505 , NURS 505L .; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Nursing process and scientific based nursing interventions to meet basic human needs using basic psycho-motor skills to support assessment, intervention, and evaluation activities.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 505L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Introduction to history of nursing and leaders in the field. Will explore contemporary nursing issues and research. Strategies to foster adherence to a professional code of ethics in practice will be examined.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Leadership development, teamwork, and activities designed for NROTC students. Learn how to write a federal resume, be a Federal Employee, and learn the skills needed to complete and present their U.S. Pacific Fleet capstone project.
metadata: Prerequisites: NAVL 100L , NAVL 101 , NAVL 102 , NAVL 201 , NAVL 202 , NAVL 303 , NAVL 304 , or NAVL 402 .; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Summer only.

course_desc: Clinic on population health nursing emphasizing application of strategies to address health disparities, inequity, social justice issues, and ethics impacting population health outcomes. Emphasis on oral and writing instruction.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 364 (or concurrent); Corequisites: NURS 451; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: Nursing majors only.

course_desc: Teaching and learning concepts applied to health promotion and prevention of common health and illness conditions with culturally diverse individuals, families, groups, and communities. Includes didactic (30 hrs) and fieldwork (45 hrs).
metadata: Repeatable: 1 time; Major Restrictions: classified graduate student status in SONDH.

course_desc: Examination of theory, research, and evidence-based inquiry to support evidence-based practice among MS prepared nurses.
course_title: Nursing Research, Theory, and Evidence-Based Practice
metadata: Major Restrictions: enrollment as a classified student in the graduate degree program in SONDH.

course_desc: Second of two courses that focuses on the delivery of advanced practice nursing in the assessment, diagnosis and management of common acute and chronic adult health problems in the acute care setting.
course_title: Human Responses to Acute and Chronic Illness-B
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 612 , NURS 612L , and NURS 613 ; no waiver.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Application of the nursing process involving human responses to psychiatric and mental illness in relation to physiologic, psychological, social, cultural, and environmental concepts. Emphasis on self-awareness, therapeutic communication, and holistic, individualized health-related outcomes.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 360 , NURS 360L , and NURS 363 .; Corequisites: NURS 465 , NURS 450 , and NURS 450L .; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Clinical lab and practicum for advanced practice nursing. Emphasis on integration of knowledge, skills and outcome evaluation.
course_title: Advanced Assessment and Clinical Reasoning Lab
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Provides a theoretical basis required for specialized clinical competence in adapting recent findings on child/ parent assessments, social and health risk indicators, the role of environment, and multidisciplinary settings in the care of pediatrics.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 612 / NURS 612L , NURS 633 and NURS 634 ; or consent.; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: This course will help students to gain knowledge of the mechanism of action, toxicity, adverse reactions, side effects, therapeutic uses, and nursing implications of the major categories of drugs.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 210 , NURS 210L , and NURS 212 .; Corequisites: NURS 220 and NURS 220L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Spring only; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Survey of biopsychological bases of and biotherapies for major mental disorders, including the schizophrenias, affective and personality disorders, pediatric and geriatric problems, and neurological dysfunctions with appropriate applications to health care.
metadata: Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.; Class Standing Restrictions: graduate standing or consent.

course_desc: Nursing care and health promotion for women, newborn, and families in acute care and community settings. Utilization of family theories and assessment tools for providing culturally sensitive, client-centered care.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 220 and NURS 220L and NURS 213 .; Corequisites: NURS 321L; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.; Class Standing Restrictions: Sophomore standing or higher.

course_desc: Provides a basic foundation for studies at the intersection of gerontology, health care, and the law and places an emphasis on proactive and preventive law for older adults in society. Junior standing or higher.
course_title: Gerontology, Health Care, and the Law (Elder Law)
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Cross-Listed: COA 449

course_desc: Focus on well-child care and nursing care of children with acute and chronic conditions. Pediatric concepts include family-centered, developmentally appropriate, and atraumatic care. Lab course taken concurrently.
course_title: Nursing Care of Children and Families
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 509L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Focuses on nursing assessment to support identification of risk factors and detection/prevention of complications from illness.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 210 , NURS 210L , and NURS 212 , or departmental approval.; Corequisites: NURS 213 and NURS 220L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Addresses the bio/ psycho/social human health response to a wide range of conditions. Health promotion, risk reduction and disease detection and nursing care treatment in the acute setting will be covered.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 513L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Introduction to the research process and an understanding of the applicability of the scientific approach to nursing. Analysis and resolution of contemporary medical ethics issues in research and general nursing practice are primary focuses.
metadata: Prerequisites: college-level statistics course.; Repeatable: 1 time; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Focuses on the basic concepts and applications of statistics as applied to nursing research.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Summer only; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Provides a broad overview of the Veteran-Military population and their unique culture, educational, and health care needs. Open to non-nursing majors.

metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.

course_desc: Professional responsibilities of nursing practice are examined through the history of nursing, practice and education, legal and ethical issues, contemporary issues, and nursing roles.
metadata: Prerequisites: admission to the School of Nursing and Dental Hygiene, or consent.; Corequisites: NURS 210 , NURS 210L , and NURS 212 .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Introduces ethical theories in discussion-based formats, fostering understanding of diverse moral, ethical, and leadership philosophies. Enhances moral character, awareness of ethical decision-making tools, and addresses contemporary dilemmas through discussion, written journaling, and a research paper.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Spring only

course_desc: Provides a framework for the development of advanced skills for systematic and comprehensive data collection, organization, precise recording, accurate assessment and communication of data reflecting the biopsychophysical status of individuals across the life span.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent.

course_desc: Application of the nursing care of the mother and family. The student will apply clinical and theoretical concepts of holistic nursing care for women experiencing customary and complicated perinatal processes.

metadata: Corequisites: NURS 508; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Introduces the process for research application and evidence-based practice. Includes: EBP questions, evidence sources, literature search and synthesis, levels and quality of evidence, and determination of clinical significance. Focus on contemporary medical ethics issues.
course_title: Principles of Nursing Research and Evidence-Based Practice
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Addresses the scientific, psycho-social, ethical, cultural, and spiritual issues surrounding genetic disease, genetic testing, and living with an inherited condition.
metadata: Repeatable: 1 time; Class Standing Restrictions: graduate standing or consent.

course_desc: Application of current knowledge regarding human behavior related to function, alteration, and/ or disruption of mental processes; applies current knowledge related to nursing care, psychiatric treatment/ psychosocial rehabilitation of identified mentally ill adults/children and their families.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 507; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Clinical course emphasizes application of knowledge and skills for nursing practice, including case management and quality management experiences. Focuses on complex clinical judgments, interdisciplinary team functioning, and leadership. Emphasis on writing instruction.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 450 and NURS 450L .; Corequisites: NURS 460; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Planned individualized study or research in specialized area related to interprofessional collaborative practice.
metadata: Prerequisites: consent.; Repeatable: 1 time; Major Restrictions: Senior undergraduate NURS students only.

course_desc: Practicum experience for students to learn the role of the professional nurse by building on previously learned knowledge and skills in the nursing program.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 360 , NURS 360L , or consent.; Repeatable: 2 times, up to 9 credits.; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Study of U.S. Navy ships professional and efficient operations. Lecture series on Fleet communications, tactical employment, relative motion plotting, seamanship, Joint Warfare, and employment of naval forces as an element of National Security.
metadata: Prerequisites: NAVL 201; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Fall only

course_desc: Introduction to the core competencies, key theoretical models and concepts that guide advanced population health nursing. The student will initiate their professional portfolio, which must be completed during the last semester of the MS program.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Clinical nursing course develops proficiency in complex clinical judgments, interprofessional team collaboration, and leadership skills in nursing. Application of knowledge, incorporation of case management and quality management experiences, and writing instruction are highlighted.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 364 (or concurrent).; Corequisites: NURS 470; Repeatable: 1 time, up to 6 credits.; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Theory course emphasizes the judgments, knowledge, and skills necessary for nursing practice, including case management and quality management experiences. The experience focuses on complex clinical judgments, interdisciplinary team functioning, and leadership.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 450 and NURS 450L , or consent.; Corequisites: NURS 460L; Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Concepts/theories of health assessment, data collection, and analysis to distinguish between health/wellness, risk factors or health deviations across the lifespan. Attention to principles of communication and interviewing.

course_desc: Limited to juniors and seniors in nursing.

Focuses on cultural aspects that influence health management in indigenous populations of Hawaiʻi, the Pacific, and Asia, with an emphasis on development of culturally sensitive strategies to promote and improve health management.

course_desc: Clinical course focuses on using nursing assessment to support identification of risk factors and detection/prevention of complications from illness. Nursing skills are integrated into clinical experiences.
metadata: Prerequisites: NURS 210 , NURS 210L , and NURS 212 .; Corequisites: NURS 213 and NURS 220 .; Grade Option: CR/NC only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Spring only; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission to GEPN only.

course_desc: Provides an advanced understanding of pathophysiologic mechanisms underlying human illness across the lifespan. Provides a foundation for formulating clinical decisions and therapeutic plans of care to promote disease prevention and health promotion.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Essential principles of pharmacology using a pathophysiologic approach with emphasis on administering medications and evaluating their effects.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 501 , NURS 502 , NURS 504 , NURS 504L , NURS 505 , NURS 505L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Clinical course focuses on complex situations requiring application of strong recognition skills and rapid decision making. Evidence base supporting assessment and nursing intervention is explored.

course_desc: Introduction to the theoretical concepts of holistic nursing care of the perinatal family. Women’s and men’s health issues are discussed.
metadata: Corequisites: NURS 508L .; Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only or consent. Admission into GEPN only.

course_desc: Introduction to epidemiologic principles and methods, with an emphasis on its application to nursing practice.
metadata: Grade Option: A-F only.; Frequency of Course (when offered): Once a year; Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Relates values, beliefs, attitudes, family organization, lifestyles, and health practices in different ethnic groups to health-care and nursing practice.

course_desc: Application of health promotion, risk reduction, and disease prevention and detection and nursing care treatments in the community setting.

course_desc: Research for doctoral dissertation.

course_desc: Analysis of various clinical management concepts and health-care delivery systems influencing outcomes, process, and costs in the delivery of care.
metadata: Major Restrictions: NURS majors only.

course_desc: Synthesis and analysis of interventions and variables that influence the rate of adoption of innovations. Application of concepts to patient populations and systems of healthcare.

course_desc: A culminating experience in nursing education program designed for students to integrate, critique, extend, and apply knowledge gained in the program.
